segment.source: Test an appx file on an IoT device.
segment.target: Test an appx file on an IoT device.

segment.source: Test an appx file on an IoT device
segment.target: Test an appx file on an IoT device

segment.source: Test an appx file on an IoT device
segment.target: Test an appx file on an IoT device

segment.source: Connect to the device from another PC**
segment.target: Connect to the device from another PC**

segment.source: Connect a network cable.
segment.target: Connect a network cable.

segment.source: Note the IP address that shows up on the device.
segment.target: Note the IP address that shows up on the device.

segment.source: On your technician PC, open Internet Explorer, and type in the address with an http:// prefix and :8080 suffix:
segment.target: On your technician PC, open Internet Explorer, and type in the address with an http:// prefix and :8080 suffix:

segment.source: This opens the Windows Device Portal.
segment.target: This opens the Windows Device Portal.

segment.source: From here, you can upload app packages, see what apps are installed, and switch between them.
segment.target: From here, you can upload app packages, see what apps are installed, and switch between them.

segment.source: Use the default username (Administrator) and password (p@ssw0rd) to log on.
segment.target: Use the default username (Administrator) and password (p@ssw0rd) to log on.

segment.source: Test the app by installing it**
segment.target: Test the app by installing it**

segment.source: Click on Apps.
segment.target: Click on Apps.

segment.source: Under Install app, under App package, click Browse, and select your .appx file.
segment.target: Under Install app, under App package, click Browse, and select your .appx file.

segment.source: Note If you built your app as a bundle, you may need to use a tool such as 7-Zip to extract these files from the bundle.
segment.target: Note If you built your app as a bundle, you may need to use a tool such as 7-Zip to extract these files from the bundle.

segment.source: Add your app's Certificate the same way.
segment.target: Add your app's Certificate the same way.

segment.source: Click Add Dependency and add each of your app's dependency files.
segment.target: Click Add Dependency and add each of your app's dependency files.

segment.source: Under Deploy, click Go.
segment.target: Under Deploy, click Go.

segment.source: The app installs.
segment.target: The app installs.

segment.source: Under Installed apps, click the drop-down box and select your app.
segment.target: Under Installed apps, click the drop-down box and select your app.

segment.source: Your app should start on the device.
segment.target: Your app should start on the device.

segment.source: Great, your app works!
segment.target: Great, your app works!

segment.source: Now let's package it up so you can maintain your app even after it's been delivered to your customers.
segment.target: Now let's package it up so you can maintain your app even after it's been delivered to your customers.
